things.thing

Interface ThingAction


  • public interface ThingAction

    A ThingAction is some sort of computation, which can take a long time or not, running in the background or not.

    The computation is executed (or started) in the execute(String, rx.Observable, java.util.Map) method, and would ideally return the result of the computation as an Observable. If the computation is expected to take too long for the client to wait for it, the result can also be a pointer to the result once it’s finished, or some other form of status.

    If the computation is a transformation of some sort, which I’d expect to be the main use-case for this, then I would advise to return the new state of the things that got transformed as result.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        rx.Observable<? extends things.thing.Thing<?>> execute(String actionName,
                                                       rx.Observable<? extends things.thing.Thing<?>> things,
                                                       Map<String,String> parameters)

        The method that performs or starts the computation for this ThingAction.

        Parameters:
        actionName - the name the action is configured (in ThingActions)
        things - the things the computation should be performed on, or that are used as input parameters
        parameters - additional parameters, usually to fine-tune behaviour
        Returns:
        result(s), link(s) to result(s), status, …

      • getSupportedActionNames

        Set<String> getSupportedActionNames()

        A list of Strings that show which action commands this Class supports.

      • ensurePopulatedValues

        default boolean ensurePopulatedValues()

        Ensures that the Things that are fed into the Action all have populated Values.

        Some actions might not need that, which will possibly increase performance because the values don’t have to be loaded at all.

        Returns:
        whether this action needs loaded values for input things (true) or not (false)

      • filterTypes

        default Set<Class> filterTypes()

        (not used at the moment)

        A filter that can be chained in before the action is executed, which can filter out Types that don’t match the ones specified here.

      • runsInBackground

        default boolean runsInBackground()

        (not used at the moment)

        If this method returns true, the ActionManager is advised to run this action in the background and not wait for it to finish.

        I haven’t figured out which result should be returned in this case.
